items.title: 5 Warren Buffett Stocks for Generating Passive Dividend Income Even If There's a Stock Market Sell-Off in 2025
items.author: The Motley Fool
items.description: The article discusses five Warren Buffett-owned stocks that can provide passive dividend income even in a potential stock market sell-off in 2025. The stocks highlighted are Coca-Cola, American Express, Visa, Chevron, and Kraft Heinz.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: The article highlights Coca-Cola's reliable business model, recession-resistant demand, and consistent dividend growth as reasons to consider it as a passive income powerhouse.
The article praises American Express's closed-loop payment network, high revenue, and ability to generate profits even during economic downturns, making it a compelling financial stock to buy.
The article notes that Visa's open-loop system and focus on transaction volume and frequency make it a high-octane growth stock, even in a market sell-off.
The article highlights Chevron's diversified business, efficient oil and gas production, strong balance sheet, and long history of dividend increases, making it a reliable dividend stock.

The article acknowledges that Kraft Heinz has been a poor performer, but its cheap valuation, recession-resistant business model, and high dividend yield make it a solid buy for risk-averse investors.
